III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility was not in need of any technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported no concerns in meeting requirements during the review
period. Chief Administrator stated the agency has good systems in place. A
change was made regarding the application process in order to collect more
information from families earlier in the process to ensure timeliness. The

assessment noted occasional delays in receiving results of background ground
checks and other third-party information. Chief Administrator expressed
confidence in the processes that are in place as well as the assessment abilities of
staff.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were identified.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed face-to-face at the agency. Staff stated the agency has
had a few challenging cases but worked together to complete the tasks. Staff did
not identify any concerns and feel supported by the agency and coworkers.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services. All files were stored securely.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
